avalancheActivity.comment: No new avalanches have been recorded in the area since before Easter. On 26.3 a size 2 avalanches fell in Eldborgargil in Bláfjöll. Hikers triggered two smaller slab avalanches in the area the same day.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Ridges are widely bare but snow has accumulated in gullies and depressions and can have formed unstable wind slabs, especially on the leesides from NE winds. No avalanches recorded since before Easter.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snowfall the week before last week and then snowdrift in N-E winds can have formed wind slabs in gullies, depressions and other places where snow accumulates. These wind slabs can be unstable in steep slopes. A weak faceted layer was spotted in a snowpit on March 26th.

travelAdvisory.comment: Large human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East. See: https://blog.vedur.is/ofanflod/2024/04/02/frettir-af-snjoflodum-2-april-2/
travelAdvisory.highlights: Large human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East. See: https://blog.vedur.is/ofanflod/2024/04/02/frettir-af-snjoflodum-2-april-2/

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægviðri og úrkomulítið, en lítilsháttar snjókoma til fjalla á fimmtudag. Talsverð dægursveifla í hita, fer upp fyrir frostmark á láglendi yfir daginn næstu daga.

avalancheActivity.comment: Small sluffs released in the sunshine on Tuesday. On Monday 1. April, a small avalanche fell on the road in Hestfjörður in Ísafjarðardjúp. On Saturday a few avalanches released in Önundarfjörður and one on Friday. Many avalanches fell in the area in the snowstorms the week before last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in NE-snowdrift and snow showers during the last few days. A few avalanches released during Easter. Weak layers may prevail in cold and calm weather over the next days. People travelling in steep terrain might trigger avalanches.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snowstorms in NE and N winds added a lot of snow in the week before last week. There has been no thaw since then and thick wind slabs are in gullies and leeside of mountains. The older wind slabs are considered rather stable in most places, but if they would release the avalanches might become big. During the last week new snow has been added in NE-winds and this snow is considered unstable. Week layers may prevail in cold and calm weather over the next days.

travelAdvisory.comment: Large human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East. See: https://blog.vedur.is/ofanflod/2024/04/02/frettir-af-snjoflodum-2-april-2/
travelAdvisory.highlights: Large human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East. See: https://blog.vedur.is/ofanflod/2024/04/02/frettir-af-snjoflodum-2-april-2/

weatherForecast.highlights: Úrkomulaust hægviðri á miðvikudag. Lítilsháttar snjókoma í austanátt á fimmtudag. Þurrt á föstudag. Frost.

avalancheActivity.comment: Snowmobile triggerd avalanche in Dýjadalur near Dalvík 2. April. Several slabs were released in the blizzard last 72hours. Small slab was triggered by skiers the april 1st. A large avalanche in Héðinsfjörður was remotely trigger by snowmobiles on March 26th. Many slabs released in strong N-winds a week ago, some of them were big.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Unsable snow. Snowmobile triggerd avalanche in Dýjadalur, near Dalvík. A lot of new snow inland in strong NE-winds last days, windslabs in most aspects. Total blizzard for a while on Eastern day, strong NNE-wind with heavy precip for a while and several slabs released

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of new snow in the mountains after northerly blizzard a week ago resulting in many slab avalanches some were quite big. Total Blizzard for a while on Eastern day, strong NNE-wind with heavy precip for a while and great snowdrift, snowshowers since then. Snowpit (Illviðrishnjúkur 26.03) showed new snow and windslab on old crust. Bond between new and old snow was rather weak with CT12. Two other snowpits from last few days showed a rather weak bond between windslab and old snow, with faceted snow and depth hoar between layers.

travelAdvisory.comment: Large human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East. See: https://blog.vedur.is/ofanflod/2024/04/02/frettir-af-snjoflodum-2-april-2/
travelAdvisory.highlights: Large human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East. See: https://blog.vedur.is/ofanflod/2024/04/02/frettir-af-snjoflodum-2-april-2/

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg breytileg átt, þurrt og frost næstu daga

avalancheActivity.comment: Multiple avalanches have been observed around Eskifjörður, most of them fallen in the strong wind and snowfall during Easter. Smaller slabs released high in SW facing slopes in Bjólfur, Seyðisfjörður. A large avalanche fell in Svartafell, likely on Tuesday morning, 2.4.
avalancheActivity.highlights: During Easter, snow was added in NE-winds and snow showers. Layered wind slabs formed and can be sensitive. People travelling in steep terrain might trigger slab avalanches

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable new snow has been added in the area. Strong NE wind and snow showers during Easter has accumulated snow in leesides of mountains, gullies and depressions.  Wind slabs have formed, especially in E-S-W aspects. The snowpack layered and very sensitive slabs have been observed in snowpits. Recent natural avalanches confirm that the snow is unstable. A persistent weak layer was also found in the older snow at high elevation.

travelAdvisory.comment: Large human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East. See: https://blog.vedur.is/ofanflod/2024/04/02/frettir-af-snjoflodum-2-april-2/
travelAdvisory.highlights: Large human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East. See: https://blog.vedur.is/ofanflod/2024/04/02/frettir-af-snjoflodum-2-april-2/
